org.wikiutils

Class IOUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wikiutils.IOUtils

  • public class IOUtils
extends Object
    Contains several read-write operations.
    Author:
    Fastily
    See Also:
    CollectionUtils, DateUtils, GUIUtils, LoginUtils, ParseUtils, StringUtils, WikiUtils

    • Method Detail

      • buildReasonCollection

        public static HashMap<String,String> buildReasonCollection(String path)
                                                    throws FileNotFoundException
        Creates a HashMap from a file. Key and Value must be separated by colons. One newline per entry. Example line: "KEY:VALUE". Useful for storing deletion/editing reasons. The text file to read from must be in UTF-8 encoding.
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the file to read from
        Returns:
        The HashMap we created by parsing the file
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException

      • loadFromFile

        public static String[] loadFromFile(String file,
                                    String prefix,
                                    String encoding)
                             throws FileNotFoundException
        Loads list of pages contained in a file into an array. One newline per item.
        Parameters:
        file - The abstract filename of the file to load from.
        prefix - Append prefix/namespace to items? If not, specify "".
        encoding - The text encoding of the file to load from.
        Returns:
        The resulting array
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the specified file was not found.

      • copyFile

        public static void copyFile(String src,
                            String dest)
                     throws FileNotFoundException,
                            IOException
        Copies a file.
        Parameters:
        src - The path of the source file
        dest - The location to copy the file to.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the source file could not be found
        IOException - If we encountered some sort of read/write error

      • fileToString

        public static String fileToString(File f,
                                  String encoding)
                           throws FileNotFoundException
        Reads the contents of a file into a String. Use with a .txt files for best results. There seems to be an issue with reading in non-standard ascii characters at the moment.
        Parameters:
        f - The file to read from
        encoding - The endcoding standard to use. (e.g. UTF-8, UTF-16)
        Returns:
        The contents of the file as a String.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the file specified does not exist.

      • writeToFile

        public static void writeToFile(String text,
                               String file)
                        throws IOException
        Writes a string to a file.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to write to file
        file - The file to use, abstract or absolute pathname
        Throws:
        IOException - If we encountered a read/write error

      • downloadFile

        public static void downloadFile(String title,
                                String localpath,
                                Wiki wiki)
                         throws IOException,
                                FileNotFoundException
        Downloads a file
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the file to download on the Wiki excluding the " File:" prefix.
        localpath - The pathname to save this file to (e.g. "/Users/Fastily/Example.jpg "). Note that if a file with that name already exists at that pathname, it will be overwritten!
        wiki - The wiki object to use.
        Throws:
        IOException - If we had a network error
        FileNotFoundException - If localpath cannot be resolved to a pathname on the local system.

      • listFilesR

        public static void listFilesR(File f,
                              ArrayList<File> fl,
                              FileFilter ff)
        Recursively searches a directory for any files (not directories).
        Parameters:
        f - The root directory to start searching in.
        fl - Any files we find will be added to this list.
        ff - Optional FileFilter. Specify null to not use one.
